title: Blended Collaborative Learning Course for Improving Engagement in Non-IT Subjects

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science knowledge and managerial-level leadership experience
context.additional_context: Blended instruction based on the ELIS (eLearning Integrated System) and practice-linked collaborative learning environments utilizing digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts of non-IT science subjects with 80% or higher accuracy using ELIS.
Through collaborative learning activities (group projects/discussions), learners propose three or more problem-solving strategies applicable to real-world work scenarios.
Learners establish self-directed learning habits, securing five or more hours per week for non-IT subject learning.

resources: Collaborative Tools for Group Activities (e.g., Slack, Notion)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
